definition:
A **multigrade operator** $\Omega$ is a parametric operator with
parameter $k$ in the set $\mathbb{N}$ of non-negative integers.

The application of a multigrade operator $\Omega$ to a finite sequence
of operands $(x_1, \ldots, x_k)$ is typically denoted with the parameter
$k$ left tacit, as the appropriate application is implicit in the number
of operands listed. Thus $\Omega(x_1, \ldots, x_k)$ may be taken for
$\Omega_k(x_1, \ldots, x_k).$
